intro: Agarista multiflora var. brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed agarista, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a smooth surface and a slightly waxy texture.
